META.graphic_title: Estimated percent of undocumented residents in U.S. metro areas
META.prose: This map shows the 50 metro areas with the highest percent of undocumented residents among the 100 largest U.S. metro areas in 2014. The largest is McAllen-Edinburg-Mission, TX with 10.2% of the population or roughly 85,000 people. The second largest is Houston-The Woodlands-Sugar Land, TX with 8.7% of the population or roughly 575,000 residents.
